Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please can you tell me:
1. How many days in the last 2 years have the cascade, cutting edge and fountains in Sheaf Square been in operation.
2. The reasons the fountains have not been in operation and the number of days each reason applied.
Yours faithfully,
Andrew Newman

Dear Andrew Newman,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Sheffield station
water fountains which we received on 15/09/2023.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 13/10/2023. Please do not hesitate to
contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Sheffield City Council ,
Please can you provide me with an update on the progress of my EIR request which seems to have been delayed without asking or informing me.
You state in your last email that, by law, the authority should  respond promptly  by 13 October 2023 which has now passed.
Yours sincerely,
Andrew Newman

Dear Mr Newman
We apologise for missing the deadline to you of 13 October 2023 about the
Cutting Edge sculpture and water fountains outside the railway station,
and their on/off status over two years.
We sent the request to our highways service in error, and then late in the
day to the service that handles Streetscene and water features, from which
we are waiting for a reply. We’ll try and get one to you  as soon as
possible.
Kind regards
Sheffield City Council

Dear Andrew Newman,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Sheffield station
water fountains which we received on 15/09/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
We don’t have a definitive number on the days Sheaf Square water feature
has been operational over the last 2 years, but it was turned off in line
with regulations from Yorkshire Water during the hosepipe ban. It goes off
on cold days as there are in-water thermometers that assess the risk of
water freezing and damaging plant equipment. We have also had a major leak
to deal with.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see

https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
